subgoal: Gather all the necessary ingredients: bacon (or pancetta or guanciale), Pecorino Romano cheese, Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, eggs, spaghetti (or pasta), kosher salt, and black pepper. Optionally, include garlic.
original_subgoals: Gather the ingredients: guanciale (or pancetta), pecorino romano cheese, free-range organic eggs, pasta, black pepper, and optionally garlic.
Gather ingredients: thick-cut bacon (or pancetta), Pecorino Romano cheese, Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, eggs, spaghetti, kosher salt, and black pepper.

subgoal: Cut the bacon or guanciale into chunks. Pancetta can be used as an alternative.
original_subgoals: Cut guanciale (pork cheek) into chunks. Pancetta can be used as an alternative.
Prepare the guanciale by removing the skin and slicing it into 1 cm thick pieces, then chop into 0.5 cm chunks.
Slice about half a pound of bacon into thick pieces, approximately three-quarters of an inch.
Chop up some bacon.

subgoal: Heat a pan over medium heat, optionally adding a bit of olive oil, and cook the bacon or guanciale until crispy or golden. Optionally, add a cracked garlic clove for flavor.
original_subgoals: Heat olive oil in a pan and add the guanciale to start the sauce.

subgoal: Bring a pot of water to a boil and add salt. Add spaghetti (or spaghettoni) to the boiling water and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
original_subgoals: Boil water and add salt at a ratio of 10 grams per liter.
Add spaghettoni (or large spaghetti) to the boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Do not add oil.
Fill a pot with water, add a tiny amount of salt, and bring it to a boil.
Twist the pasta with two hands and place it into the boiling water to prevent sticking. Cook for 8 minutes.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and add about a tablespoon of kosher salt to four quarts of water.
Boil water, add salt, and cook spaghetti in it.
Cook the spaghetti in the boiling water for about 10 minutes until slightly al dente.
Boil water, add salt, and cook spaghetti in it.

subgoal: Grate Pecorino Romano and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese. Crack black peppercorns using a pestle and mortar, then sieve to separate the hotter inner part of the peppercorns for use.
original_subgoals: Crack black peppercorns using a pestle and mortar, then sieve to separate the hotter inner part of the peppercorns for use.
Grate about three ounces each of Pecorino Romano and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese using a fine grater.
Grate pecorino romano cheese into the egg yolks.

subgoal: Separate egg yolks from egg whites and whisk together with whole eggs. Gradually whisk the grated cheese into the egg mixture and add freshly ground black pepper to taste.
original_subgoals: In a bowl, beat two egg yolks (for two people). Do not add cream.
Add grated parmesan or pecorino cheese and abundant pepper to the egg yolks and mix to create the sauce.
Crack the eggs into a bowl and add about 20 grams of pecorino romano cheese. Whisk together.
In a bowl, whisk together three whole eggs and two egg yolks.
Separate egg yolks from egg whites using the thumb trick or back and forth method.
Gradually whisk the grated cheese into the egg mixture until well combined.
Add freshly ground black pepper to the egg and cheese mixture to taste.
Grate pecorino romano cheese into the egg yolks.
Add pepper to the egg yolk and cheese mixture.

subgoal: Once the bacon or guanciale is cooked, turn off the heat and drain most of the fat, leaving some in the pan. Remove the garlic if used.
original_subgoals: If desired, remove excess fat from the guanciale using a paper towel.
Once the guanciale is golden, remove the garlic from the pan.
Once the bacon is rendered, turn off the heat and drain most of the fat, leaving about two tablespoons in the pan.
Cook the bacon in a pan and then turn off the heat to let it cool.

subgoal: Reserve some pasta water and drain the spaghetti. Add the drained spaghetti to the pan with the bacon or guanciale fat (heat off), allowing it to cool slightly.
original_subgoals: Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and add it to the pan with the guanciale, allowing it to cool slightly.
Turn off the heat under the pan with guanciale and add the cooked pasta directly from the pot, along with some pasta water, to the pan.
Reserve some pasta water and drain the spaghetti.
Add a bit of pasta water to the egg yolk and cheese mixture to help melt the cheese.
Add the drained spaghetti to the pan with the bacon fat (heat off).
Transfer cooked spaghetti directly from the water into the bacon pan.

subgoal: Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot spaghetti, stirring gently to coat the pasta without scrambling the eggs.
original_subgoals: Add the egg and cheese mixture to the pasta and stir to coat the pasta without scrambling the eggs.

subgoal: If needed, add a little reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce and achieve a creamy consistency. Finish with additional pepper and grated cheese, and garnish with crispy bacon pieces.
original_subgoals: Serve the pasta with additional parmesan or pecorino cheese and a touch of pepper for decoration.
Finish the dish with additional cracked black pepper and a sprinkle of pecorino romano cheese.
If needed, add a little reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce and achieve a creamy consistency.
Add more pasta water to the pan to make the sauce creamy.
Plate the pasta and garnish with additional grated Parmigiano Reggiano and crispy bacon pieces.
Finish with additional pepper and grated pecorino or parmesan cheese.

subgoal: Serve immediately and enjoy your homemade Pasta Carbonara with friends or family.
original_subgoals: Serve immediately and enjoy with friends or family.
Serve immediately and enjoy your homemade Pasta Carbonara.
